sen.j: 足利氏（あしかがし）は、日本の武家のひとつ。
sen.e: The Ashikaga Family is one of the Japanese samurai families.
The Ashikaga Clan was a Japanese samurai family.
The Ashikaga clan was a Japanese samurai family.

sen.j: 本姓は源氏。
sen.e: The Ashikaga Family is of the Genji Clan.
It was a branch of the Genji Clan.
sen.cmt: "The Ashikaga Family is"→"It was a branch"
sen.e: It was a branch of the Genji clan.

sen.j: 家系は清和源氏の一族の河内源氏の流れを汲み、鎌倉幕府においては御家人であると同時に将軍家一門たる門葉の地位にあった。
sen.e: The family is of Kawachi-Genji, a family of the Seiwa-Genji Clan; in the Kamakura Shogunate, the family served as a vassal and belonged to the first circle of the Shogunate family.
The family was descended from the Kawachi-Genji branch of the Seiwa-Genji Clan and, as members of the shogun family, served as vassals to the Kamakura Shogunate.
sen.cmt: "is"→"was descended from"", a family"→"branch"Rewrote final part of sentence for clarity.
sen.e: The family was descended from the Kawachi-Genji branch of the Seiwa-Genji clan and, as members of the shogun family, served as vassals to the Kamakura Shogunate.

sen.j: 室町時代には嫡流が足利将軍家として天下人となった。
sen.e: In the Muromachi period, the main line of the family came to reign Japan as the Ashikaga Shogunate House.
During the Muromachi period, the main line of the family ruled Japan as the Ashikaga Shogunate.
During the Muromachi period, the main line of the family ruled Japan as the Ashikaga Shogunate.

sen.j: 藤原秀郷の子孫の足利氏 (藤原氏)（藤姓足利氏）に対して源姓足利氏という場合がある。
sen.e: The family may sometimes be referred to as the Ashikaga Clan of the "Gen" Family to differentiate it from an Ashikaga family of the Fujiwara Clan, or the Ashikaga Clan of the "To" Family, which was established by descendants of Hidesato FUJIWARA.
The family is sometimes referred to as the Genji-Ashikaga Clan to differentiate it from the unrelated Ashikaga branch of the Fujiwara Clan, which was established by descendants of Hidesato FUJIWARA.

The family is sometimes referred to as the Genji-Ashikaga clan to differentiate it from the unrelated Ashikaga branch of the Fujiwara clan, which was established by descendants of FUJIWARA no Hidesato.

sen.j: 平安時代に河内源氏の棟梁、源義家（八幡太郎義家）の三男・源義国（足利式部大夫）は下野国足利荘（栃木県足利市）を領有、次男・源義康以降の子孫は足利氏を称する。
sen.e: MINAMOTO Yoshikuni (Ashikaga Shikibu no Tayu, the third officer of the Ceremonies and Personnel Office), a third son of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie (Hachiman Taro Yoshiie), who was the head of the Kawachi-Genji Clan, owned the Ashikaga Manor in the Province of Shimotsuke (today's Ashikaga city, Tochigi prefecture) in the Heian period; descendants after MINAMOTO no Yoshiyasu, the second son of MINAMOTO Yoshikuni, assumed the name the Ashikaga Family.
sen.cmt: この日本語では「源義康」は「源義家」の次男としか考えられません。調べ直した結果、義康は義国の次男でした。
sen.e: During the Heian period, MINAMOTO Yoshikuni (a bureaucrat with the title of Shikibu no Tayu), who was the third son of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie (also known as Hachimantaro Yoshiie) and head of the Kawachi-Genji Clan, owned the Ashikaga fief in the Province of Shimotsuke (present-day Ashikaga city, Tochigi prefecture) and the descendents of his second son, Yoshiyasu, took the name Ashikaga.
sen.cmt: Reworded sentence for clarity though the Japanese original isn't written very well. "Manor"→"fief""today's"→"present-day"
sen.e: During the Heian period, MINAMOTO no Yoshikuni (a bureaucrat with the title of Shikibu no Tayu), who was the third son of MINAMOTO no Yoshiie (also known as Hachimantaro Yoshiie) and head of the Kawachi-Genji clan, owned the Ashikaga fief in the Province of Shimotsuke (present-day Ashikaga city, Tochigi prefecture) and the descendents of his second son, Yoshiyasu, took the name Ashikaga.

sen.j: 新田氏とは同祖の関係である。
sen.e: Their family and the Nitta Family shared the same ancestral origin.
This was also the origins of the Nitta Clan
This was also the origins of the Nitta clan

sen.j: 義国の次男・源義康（足利義康）は鳥羽天皇の北面の武士となり、保元の乱においても平清盛、源義朝と共に戦う。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshiyasu (Yoshiyasu ASHIKAGA), second son of Yoshikuni, became a "Hokumen no Bushi," or bushi guarding the Palace of the Retired Emperor, for Emperor Toba and was involved in the Hogen Disturbance as a bushi together with TAIRA no Kiyomori and MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo.

MINAMOTO no Yoshiyasu (Yoshiyasu ASHIKAGA), the second son of Yoshikuni, was a member of cloistered Empereor Toba's imperial guard (Hokumen no Bushi) and was involved in the Hogen Rebellion together with TAIRA no Kiyomori and MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo.
sen.cmt: Added "the""Retired Emperor, for Emperor Toba"→"cloistered Empereor Toba's"Deleted"as a bushi""Disturbance"→"Rebellion"
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshiyasu (Yoshiyasu ASHIKAGA), the second son of Yoshikuni, was a member of cloistered Emperor Toba's imperial guard (Hokumen no Bushi) and was involved in the Hogen Rebellion together with TAIRA no Kiyomori and MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo.

sen.j: 藤原季範の娘（実は季範長男藤原範忠の娘＝源頼朝の母の姪）を妻にしている。
sen.e: He had as his wife a daughter of FUJIWARA no Suenori, who was in fact a daughter of FUJIWARA no Noritada, eldest son of Suenori and a niece of the mother of MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.
His wife was FUJIWARA no Suenori's daughter, who was in fact a daughter of Suenori's eldest son, FUJIWARA no Noritada, and a niece of the mother of MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.
sen.cmt: Deleted "He had as"Changed word order of middle section
sen.e: His wife was FUJIWARA no Suenori's daughter, who was in fact a daughter of Suenori's eldest son, FUJIWARA no Noritada, and a niece of the mother of MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.

sen.j: その子足利義兼は治承4年（1180年）の源頼朝挙兵に参加して、治承・寿永の乱、奥州合戦などに参加し、鎌倉幕府の有力御家人としての地位を得、御門葉として源氏将軍家の一門的地位にあった。
sen.e: His son Yoshikane ASHIKAGA participated in the army of MINAMOTO no Yoritomo in 1180 and fought in the battles of the Jisho-Jyuei Disturbance and the Battle of Oshu to win the rank of one of the important senior vassals of the Kamakura Shogunate and the membership of the first circle of the Shogunate family.

His son, Yoshikane ASHIKAGA, joined MINAMOTO no Yoritomo's army in 1180 and fought in the Genpei War and the Battle of Oshu, rising to the rank of an important senior vassal of the Kamakura Shogunate and the membership of the first circle of the Shogunate family.

His son, Yoshikane ASHIKAGA, joined MINAMOTO no Yoritomo's army in 1180 and fought in the Genpei War and the Battle of Oshu, rising to the rank of an important senior vassal of the Kamakura Shogunate and the membership of the first circle of the Shogunate family.

sen.j: 義兼が頼朝の妻北条政子の妹を妻に迎えたのをはじめとして、鎌倉時代に代々北条氏と縁戚関係を結ぶ。
sen.e: The Ashikaga Family started blood connections with the Hojyo Family in the Kamakura Period when Yoshikane married a younger sister of Yoritomo's wife Masako HOJYO.
In the Kamakura Period, the Ashikaga Clan developed ties with the Hojo Clan when Yoshikane married a younger sister of Yoritomo's wife, Masako HOJO.
sen.cmt: Moved "in the Kamakura Period""started blood connections"→"developed ties"Changed spelling of "Hojyo""Family"→"Clan"
sen.e: In the Kamakura Period, the Ashikaga clan developed ties with the Hojo clan when Yoshikane married a younger sister of Yoritomo's wife, Masako HOJO.

sen.j: 足利義氏 (足利家3代目当主)以降のことと思われるが、上総国・三河国の守護職を務める。
sen.e: Members of the Ashikaga Family served Shugo-ship of the Provinces of Kazusa and Mikawa probably after Yoshiuji ASHIKAGA (third head of the Ashikaga Family).
The Ashikaga Clan served as Shugo (Governors) of Kazusa and Mikawa Provinces, possibly from the time of Yoshiuji ASHIKAGA, the third head of the family.
The Ashikaga clan served as Shugo (Governors) of Kazusa and Mikawa Provinces, possibly from the time of Yoshiuji ASHIKAGA, the third head of the family.

sen.j: また細川氏、斯波氏、渋川氏、一色氏、畠山氏、吉良氏、今川氏などの庶流を分出し、一族は全国に広がった。
sen.e: The Ashikaga Family also gave birth to many side lines including the Houses of Hosokawa, Shiba, Shibukawa, Isshiki, Hatakeyama, Kira, and Imagawa, spreading all over the country.
The Ashikaga Clan also gave rise to many branch clans, including the Houses of Hosokawa, Shiba, Shibukawa, Isshiki, Hatakeyama, Kira, and Imagawa, spreading all over the country.
The Ashikaga clan also gave rise to many branch clans, including the Houses of Hosokawa, Shiba, Shibukawa, Isshiki, Hatakeyama, Kira, and Imagawa, spreading all over the country.

sen.j: 源氏将軍家滅亡後も北条氏とは婚姻や偏諱を通じて良好な従属関係を維持してきた。
sen.e: The Ashikaga Family remained a good subordinate to the Hojyo Family through marriages and granted use of characters of the names of Hojyo people even after the collapse of the Minamoto Shogunate Family,
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the downfall of the Minamoto Clan, the Ashikaga Clan maintained a good, though subordinate, relationship with the Hojo Clan, continuing to intermarry and being granted use of Chinese characters from the names of Hojo people.
sen.cmt: "Family"→"Clan""collapse of the Minamoto Shogunate Family"→"downfall of the Minamoto Clan""remained a good subordinate to"→"maintained a good, though subordinate, relationship with"Changed spelling of "Hojyo"
sen.e: After the downfall of the Minamoto clan, the Ashikaga clan maintained a good, although subordinate, relationship with the Hojo clan, continuing to intermarry and being granted use of Chinese characters from the names of Hojo people.

sen.j: 第4代当主・足利泰氏は幕府に無断で出家（一説では、謀反の疑いがあったとされるが真偽は不明である）・引退し、第5代当主・足利頼氏と上杉重房の娘の間に生まれた第6代当主・足利家時は霜月騒動に関連して自害したと言われている。
sen.e: The fourth family head Yasuuji ASHIKAGA entered priesthood and retired without any permission from the Shogunate (one theory says he did so because of the alleged charge of rebellion, but there is no evidence to prove it), and the sixth family head Ietoki ASHIKAGA born to the fifth head Yoriuji ASHIKAGA and a daughter of Shigefusa UESUGI is said to have committed suicide because of his involvement in the November Disturbance.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The fourth family head Yasuuji ASHIKAGA retired and entered the priesthood without any permission from the Shogunate (one theory, unsupported by evidence, says he did so because of a charge of rebellion), and the sixth family head Ietoki ASHIKAGA, born to the fifth head Yoriuji ASHIKAGA and a daughter of Shigefusa UESUGI, is said to have committed suicide because of his involvement in the Shimotsuki Disturbance.
sen.cmt: Swapped "retired" and "entered""but there is no evidence to prove it"→"unsupported by evidence"Added commas"November"→"Shimotsuki"
sen.e: The fourth family head Yasuuji ASHIKAGA retired and entered the priesthood without any permission from the Shogunate (one theory, unsupported by evidence, says he did so because of a charge of rebellion), and the sixth family head Ietoki ASHIKAGA, born to the fifth head Yoriuji ASHIKAGA and a daughter of Shigefusa UESUGI, is said to have committed suicide because of his involvement in the Shimotsuki Disturbance.

sen.j: 第7代当主・足利貞氏は正室である北条一族の金沢顕時の娘・釈迦堂殿との間に長男・足利高義をもうけたが、高義は早世したため上杉重房の子・上杉頼重の娘・上杉清子との間にもうけた足利尊氏（高氏）が足利氏第8代当主を継いだ。
sen.e: Seventh family head Sadauji ASHIKAGA had the eldest son Takayoshi ASHIKAGA with Shakado-dono, his official wife, who was a daughter of Akitoki KANAZAWA, a member of the Hojyo Family, but since Takayoshi died young, Takauji ASHIKAGA, born to Sadauji and Kiyoko UESUGI, daughter of Yorishige UESUGI, son of Shigefusa UESUGI, inherited the role of the 8th head of the Ashikaga Family.

Takayoshi Ashikaga, the eldest son of the seventh family head Sadauji ASHIKAGA by his wife, Lady Shakado, who was a daughter of Akitoki KANAZAWA of the Hojo Family, died young so Takauji ASHIKAGA, Sadauji's son by Kiyoko UESUGI, the daughter of Yorishige UESUGI, who was the son of Shigefusa UESUGI, became the 8th head of the Ashikaga Family.

Takayoshi Ashikaga, the eldest son of the seventh family head Sadauji ASHIKAGA by his wife, Lady Shakado, who was a daughter of Akitoki KANAZAWA of the Hojo family, died young so Takauji ASHIKAGA, Sadauji's son by Kiyoko UESUGI, the daughter of Yorishige UESUGI, who was the son of Shigefusa UESUGI, became the 8th head of the Ashikaga family.

sen.j: 清子との間には尊氏と並んで両将軍と呼ばれた足利直義ももうけている。
sen.e: Kiyoko also gave birth to Yoshinao ASHIKAGA, who was called one of the "Two Shoguns," together with Takauji.
Kiyoko also gave birth to Yoshinao ASHIKAGA, who, together with Takauji, became known as the "Two Shoguns."
sen.cmt: "was called one of the "Two Shoguns," together with Takauji"→", together with Takauji, became known as the "Two Shoguns""
sen.e: Kiyoko also gave birth to Yoshinao ASHIKAGA, who, together with Takauji, became known as the Two Shoguns.
sen.cmt: 原文に『』がないので" "を削除

sen.j: 尊氏は正慶2年（1333年）に後醍醐天皇の挙兵に応じて鎌倉幕府を倒す功績を挙げた。
sen.e: In 1333, Takauji joined the forces against the Kamakura Shogunate following the raising of the army by Emperor Godaigo and made a great achievement in falling down the shogunate.
In 1333, Takauji joined, and contributed greatly to, the army raised by Emperor Godaigo to overthrow the Kamakura Shogunate.
sen.cmt: Reworded sentence"in falling down"→"to overthrow""made a great achievement"→"contributed greatly to"
sen.e: In 1333, Takauji joined, and contributed greatly to, the army raised by Emperor Godaigo to overthrow the Kamakura Shogunate.

tit.e: Period of the Northern and Southern Court
Period of the Northern and Southern Court
Period of the Northern and Southern Court

sen.j: 尊氏は後醍醐天皇の建武の新政から離反した後、光明天皇を擁立して京都に室町幕府を興し、征夷大将軍に任じられた。
sen.e: After breaking away from the New Administration of Kenmu conducted by Emperor Godaigo, Takauji set up his own government Muromachi Shogunate in Kyoto with Emperor Komyo as his nominal master and was appointed the Seii Taishogun (Barbarian Subduing Generalissimo).

After becoming disillusioned with Kenmu Restoration that returned power to Emperor Godaigo, Takauji set up the Muromachi Shogunate in Kyoto with Emperor Komyo as his nominal master and was appointed the Seii Taishogun (literally Barbarian Subduing Generalissimo).
sen.cmt: "breaking away from"→"becoming disillusioned with""New Administration of Kenmu"→"becoming disillusioned with""conducted by"→"that returned power to""his own government"→"the"Added "literally"
sen.e: After becoming disillusioned with Kenmu Restoration that returned power to Emperor Godaigo, Takauji set up the Muromachi Shogunate in Kyoto with Emperor Komyo as his nominal master and was appointed the Seii Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians").
sen.cmt: 征夷大将軍、説明訂正→(literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians")

sen.j: しかしその後は南北朝の動乱の中で室町幕府は常に存亡の危機に立たされ、尊氏の孫で第3代将軍・足利義満の時代になって南北朝合一を達成することとなる。
sen.e: The Muromachi Shogunate, however, was always kept on the verge of collapse because of the disturbances caused by the antagonism between the Northern and Southern Imperial Courts until Takauji's grandson and the third shogun Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA reunited the two separated courts into one.

The Muromachi Shogunate, however, was always kept on the verge of collapse because of the disturbances caused by the antagonism between the Northern and Southern Imperial Courts until Takauji's grandson and third Shogun, Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, reunited the two courts.

The Muromachi Shogunate, however, was always kept on the verge of collapse because of the disturbances caused by the antagonism between the Northern and Southern Imperial Courts until Takauji's grandson and third Shogun, Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, reunited the two courts.

sen.j: 足利義満は明徳の乱、応永の乱などで有力守護大名を挑発しては討伐してその勢力を削減した。
sen.e: Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA intentionally provoked important Shugo (Military Governor) Daimyo into rebel against the shogunate (Meitoku Rebellion and Oei Rebellion), defeated and reduced their forces.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA intentionally provoked important Shugo Daimyo (Lords) into rebelling against the shogunate (the Meitoku and Oei Rebellions) and by defeating them, reduced their power.
Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA intentionally provoked important Shugo Daimyo (Lords) into rebelling against the shogunate (the Meitoku and Oei Rebellions) and by defeating them, reduced their power.

sen.j: そして中国の明王朝から「日本国王」として冊封を受けて天皇に迫る権威を確立するなどして、幕府の安定化と全盛期を築き上げた。
sen.e: He was then granted the title "King of Japan" by the Ming Dynasty of China to establish authority almost equal to that of the Emperor of Japan, thereby stabilizing his military government and leading to the heyday of the shogunate.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was then granted the title "King of Japan" by the Ming Dynasty of China, establishing his authority as almost equal to that of the Emperor, thereby stabilizing his military government and leading to the heyday of the shogunate.

He was then granted the title 'King of Japan' by the Ming Dynasty of China, establishing his authority as almost equal to that of the Emperor, thereby stabilizing his military government and leading to the heyday of the shogunate.

sen.j: しかし義満が死去すると次第に将軍権力の弱体化、守護大名の台頭が顕著になって行く。
sen.e: But the death of Yoshimitsu started gradual weakening of the power of the shogunate to eventually allow the apparent rising of the power of Shugo Daimyo.
However, following the death of Yoshimitsu, the Shogunate's power gradually weakened, leading to the rise to power of the Shugo Daimyo.
sen.cmt: "But"→"However"Added "following""started gradual weakening of the power of the shogunate"→"the Shogunate's power gradually weakened""to eventually allow the apparent rising of the"→"leading to the rise to"
sen.e: However, following the death of Yoshimitsu, the Shogunate's power gradually weakened, leading to the rise to power of the Shugo Daimyo (Japanese territorial lord as provincial constable).
sen.cmt: 守護大名、説明補足→(Japanese territorial lord as provincial constable)

sen.j: 第6代将軍・足利義教は父・義満の政治路線を受け継いで将軍権力の強化を行なったが、そのあまりに強硬的なやり方は周囲の反発を招いた。
sen.e: The sixth shogun Yoshinori ASHIKAGA attempted to reinforce the shogunall authority by following the political line of his father Yoshimitsu, but his excessively tough actions caused objection among his vassals.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The sixth shogun, Yoshinori ASHIKAGA, attempted to reinforce shogunal authority by following his father's policies but his excessively harsh actions caused objection among his vassals.
sen.cmt: Deleted "the""the political line of his father Yoshimitsu→"his father's policies""tough"→"harsh"
sen.e: The sixth shogun, Yoshinori ASHIKAGA, attempted to reinforce shogunal authority by following his father's policies but his excessively harsh actions caused objection among his vassals.

sen.j: 嘉吉の乱で暗殺されるに至って、遂に将軍権力の衰退と権威の失墜が露呈する結果となった。
sen.e: When he was assassinated in the Kakitsu Incident, the dwindling of the shogunate power and the fall of the shogunate authority became apparent.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When he was assassinated in the Kakitsu Incident, the dwindling of the Shogun's power and the decline of shogunate authority became apparent.
When he was assassinated in the Kakitsu Incident, the dwindling of the Shogun's power and the decline of shogunate authority became apparent.

sen.j: 第8代将軍・足利義政の時代には後継ぎ問題などをめぐって応仁の乱が発生し、室町幕府は京都だけを支配する一地方政権に転落した。
sen.e: In the days of the 8th shogun Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, the Onin War broke out partly as a result of the heir problems in the Shogunate House, and consequently the Muromachi Shogunate shrank into a local administration that only controlled Kyoto.

The rule of the 8th Shogun, Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, saw the outbreak of the Onin War, partly as a result of disputes over succession, and consequently the Muromachi Shogunate was left in control of only Kyoto.
sen.cmt: "In the days"→"The rule""broke out"→"saw the outbreak of""the heir problems in the Shogunate House"→"disputes over succession""shrank into a local administration that only controlled"→"was left in control of only"
sen.e: The rule of the 8th Shogun, Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, saw the outbreak of the Onin War, partly as a result of disputes over succession, and consequently the Muromachi Shogunate was left in control of only Kyoto.

sen.j: 第10代将軍・足利義稙（義稙）は管領の細川政元によって将軍職を追われ（明応の政変）、以後の将軍は実権を奪われて名目的存在となり、有力大名の支持なくしては将軍の地位さえ保てなくなった。
sen.e: The 10th shogun Yoshitane ASHIKAGA was forced to leave the shogunship by Masamoto HOSOKAWA, kanrei (shogunal deputy), (Meio Coup d'Etat), and following shoguns became a mere nominal figurehead with no practical authority and could not maintain the title of shogun without support of powerful daimyos.

The 10th Shogun, Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, was forced to resign by Kanrei (shogunal deputy) Masamoto HOSOKAWA, and following shoguns became mere nominal figureheads with no practical authority and unable to maintain the title of Shogun without the support of powerful daimyos.
sen.cmt: "leave the shogunship"→"resign"Changed word orderDeleted "a"Made "figurehead" plural"could not"→"unable to"Added "the"
sen.e: The tenth Shogun, Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, was forced to resign by Kanrei (shogunal deputy) Masamoto HOSOKAWA, and following shoguns became mere nominal figureheads with no practical authority and unable to maintain the title of Shogun without the support of powerful daimyos.

sen.j: その後、足利将軍家では将軍の若死になども相次ぎ、第13代将軍・足利義輝の時代にわずかに将軍権力が復興される兆しもあった。
sen.e: Shoguns succeeding Yoshitane died young, but there was a slight sign of restoration in the shogunal power during the days of the 13th Shogun Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Shoguns succeeding Yoshitane died young, but there was a slight restoration of power during the days of the 13th Shogun Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA.
Shoguns succeeding Yoshitane died young, but there was a slight restoration of power during the days of the thirteenth Shogun Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: 永禄8年（1565年）5月に松永久秀らによって暗殺されてしまい、将軍は有名無実化した。
sen.e: Yoshiteru, however, was assassinated by Hisahide MATSUNAGA and others in May 1565, and since then the title of shogun became purely nominal.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yoshiteru, however, was assassinated by Hisahide MATSUNAGA and others in May 1565, and the title of Shogun became purely nominal.
Yoshiteru, however, was assassinated by Hisahide MATSUNAGA and others in June 1565, and the title of Shogun became purely nominal.

sen.j: なお、義輝暗殺後の3年間、室町幕府では将軍空位の時代が続き、一時的に幕府は消滅している。
sen.e: No shogun was appointed in the period of three years after assassination of Yoshiteru, which means the Muromachi Shogunate temporarily disappeared.
No shogun was appointed in the three years after Yoshiteru's assassination and, as such, the Muromachi Shogunate temporarily disappeared.
sen.cmt: Deleted "period of"Moved "Yoshiteru" and made it possessive"which means"→"and as such"
sen.e: No shogun was appointed in the three years after Yoshiteru's assassination and, as such, the Muromachi Shogunate temporarily disappeared.

sen.j: 義輝の実弟・足利義昭は、永禄11年（1568年）に織田信長に擁されて上洛し、第15代将軍となった。
sen.e: The younger brother of Yoshiteru, Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, entered Kyoto and became the 15th Shogun with the support of Nobunaga ODA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1568, the younger brother of Yoshiteru, Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, entered Kyoto with Nobunaga ODA, who made him the 15th Shogun
sen.cmt: Added date"and became the 15th Shogun with the support of Nobunaga ODA"→"with Nobunaga ODA, who made him the 15th Shogun"
sen.e: In 1568, the younger brother of Yoshiteru, Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, entered Kyoto with Nobunaga ODA, who made him the fifteenth Shogun.

sen.j: やがて信長と対立して元亀4年（1573年）に追放され、室町幕府は終焉を迎えた。
sen.e: But he came to be antagonistic to Nobunaga and was expelled from Kyoto in 1573, which marked the termination of the Muromachi Shogunate.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: though they later fell out and, in 1573, Yoshiaki was expelled from Kyoto, marking the end of the Muromachi Shogunate.
Although they later fell out and, in 1573, Yoshiaki was expelled from Kyoto, marking the end of the Muromachi Shogunate.

tit.cmt: Moved "Kanto"Deleted "Houses"- I think this is usually known as the Kanto Kubo in English

sen.j: 尊氏の子で関東支配のために父によって派遣された鎌倉公方・足利基氏は鎌倉を中心として関東を支配した。
sen.e: Motouji ASHIKAGA, son of Takauji, who was sent by his father to the Kanto area to control this local district and came to be called Kamakura Kubo (quasi-shogun), controlled Kanto with Kamakura as his central base.
Motouji ASHIKAGA, was sent by his father, Takauji, to control the Kanto area and because he was based in Kamakura, came to be called the Kamakura Kubo (quasi-shogun).
Motouji ASHIKAGA, was sent by his father, Takauji, to control the Kanto area and because he was based in Kamakura, came to be called the Kamakura Kubo (quasi-shogun).

sen.j: しかし基氏の死後、その子孫は京都の室町幕府将軍家と対立・抗争を繰り返し、遂に第4代公方・足利持氏に至っては第6代将軍・足利義教と衝突する事態に至った（永享の乱）。
sen.e: But after his death, his descendants repeated opposition against and conflicts with the Muromachi Shogunate House in Kyoto, and an actual clash finally occurred between the fourth Kubo Mochiuji ASHIKAGA and the sixth shogun Yoshinori ASHIKAGA (Eikyo Incident).

But after his death, his descendants repeatedly clashed with the Muromachi Shogunate in Kyoto until actual conflict finally broke out between the fourth Kubo Mochiuji ASHIKAGA and the sixth shogun Yoshinori ASHIKAGA (Eikyo Incident).
sen.cmt: "repeated opposition against and conflicts"→"repeatedly clashed"Deleted "House", "an""clash"→"conflict""occurred"→"broke out"
sen.e: But after his death, his descendants repeatedly clashed with the Muromachi Shogunate in Kyoto until actual conflict finally broke out between the fourth Kubo Mochiuji ASHIKAGA and the sixth shogun Yoshinori ASHIKAGA (Eikyo Incident).

sen.j: この戦いに敗れた持氏は義教の命令で自害を余儀なくされ、鎌倉公方家は滅亡した。
sen.e: Mochiuji was lost in this battle and forced to commit suicide by the order of Yoshinori, and then the Kamakura Kubo House was abolished.
Mochiuji was defeated in this battle and forced to commit suicide on Yoshinori's orders, and the Kamakura Kubo was abolished.
sen.cmt: "lost"→"defeated""by the order of Yoshinori"→"on Yoshinori's orders"Deleted "House"
sen.e: Mochiuji was defeated in this battle and forced to commit suicide on Yoshinori's orders, and the Kamakura Kubo was abolished.

sen.j: しかし義教の死後、義教によって助命されていた持氏の末子・足利成氏が足利義政より再興を許されて、第5代鎌倉公方となった。
sen.e: After the death of Yoshinori, the youngest son of Mochiuji, Shigeuji ASHIKAGA, whose life was spared by Yoshinori, was permitted to restore the Kubo House by Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA and became the 5th Kamakura Kubo.

After the death of Yoshinori, the youngest son of Mochiuji, Shigeuji ASHIKAGA, whose life was spared by Yoshinori, was permitted to revive the position by Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA and became the 5th Kamakura Kubo.

After the death of Yoshinori, the youngest son of Mochiuji, Shigeuji ASHIKAGA, whose life was spared by Yoshinori, was permitted to revive the position by Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA and became the 5th Kamakura Kubo.

sen.j: しかし成氏は関東管領の上杉氏と対立し、鎌倉を放棄して下総国古河に移って古河公方と称した。
sen.e: Shigeuji, however, came to have a conflict with the Uesugi Family, who served as Kanto-Kanrei (Governor General of Kanto), abandoned Kamakura to relocate to Koga in the Province of Shimousa, and assumed the title Koga Kubo.

Shigeuji, however, came into conflict with the Uesugi Clan, who served as Kanto-Kanrei (Governor General of Kanto), and he fled Kamakura, relocating to Koga in the Province of Shimousa and assuming the title, Koga Kubo.
sen.cmt: "to have a"→"into""Family"→"Clan""abandoned"→"and he fled""to relocate"→", relocating""assumed"→"assuming"
sen.e: Shigeuji, however, came into conflict with the Uesugi clan, who served as Kanto-Kanrei (Governor General of Kanto), and he fled Kamakura, relocating to Koga in the Province of Shimousa and assuming the title, Koga Kubo.

sen.j: 成氏の死後、古河公方家では内紛が相次いで衰退し、第5代公方・足利義氏 (古河公方)が天正11年（1583年）に死去すると、古河公方家は断絶した。
sen.e: The death of Shigeuji triggered internal strife in the Koga Kubo House to eventually deteriorate the authority of the House, and the death of the 5th Kubo Yoshiuji ASHIKAGA in 1583 finally terminated the Koga Kubo House.

Infighting triggered by the death of Shigeuji caused the authority of the Koga Kubo to eventually deteriorate, and with the death of the 5th Kubo, Yoshiuji ASHIKAGA in 1583, the Koga Kubo came to an end.

Infighting triggered by the death of Shigeuji caused the authority of the Koga Kubo to eventually deteriorate, and with the death of the 5th Kubo, Yoshiuji ASHIKAGA in 1583, the Koga Kubo came to an end.

sen.j: なお、足利義政の弟・足利政知から始まる堀越公方家は、第2代公方・足利茶々丸の時代に北条早雲によって滅ぼされた。
sen.e: The Horigoe Kubo House, started by Masatomo ASHIKAGA, younger brother of Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, was destroyed by Soun HOJYO under the days of the second Kubo Chachamaru ASHIKAGA.
The Horigoe Kubo House, started by Masatomo ASHIKAGA, the younger brother of Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, was destroyed by Soun HOJO during the rule of the second Kubo, Chachamaru ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: Added "the"Changed spelling of "HOJYO""under the days"→"during the rule"
sen.e: The Horigoe Kubo House, started by Masatomo ASHIKAGA, the younger brother of Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, was destroyed by Soun HOJO during the rule of the second Kubo, Chachamaru ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: 第2代古河公方である足利政氏の次男・足利義明から始まる小弓公方家も天文 (日本)7年（1538年）に北条氏綱によって滅ぼされた。
sen.e: The Oyumi Kubo House, established by Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, second son of the 2nd Koga Kubo Masauji ASHIKAGA, was also destroyed by Ujitsuna HOJYO in 1538.
The Oyumi Kubo House, established by Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, the second son of the 2nd Koga Kubo, Masauji ASHIKAGA, was also destroyed by Ujitsuna HOJO in 1538.
The Oyumi Kubo House, established by Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, the second son of the 2nd Koga Kubo, Masauji ASHIKAGA, was also destroyed by Ujitsuna HOJO in 1538.

sen.j: こうして戦国時代までに、関東足利氏は政治の表舞台からことごとく姿を消すこととなる。
sen.e: Thus, the Ashikaga Families in Kanto were totally wiped out of the political scene in Kanto by the Period of Warring States of Japan.
Thus, the Ashikaga Clan in Kanto were totally erased from the political scene in by the start of the Period of Warring States.
sen.cmt: "Families"→"Clan""wiped out of"→"erased from"Deleted "in Kanto", "of Japan"Added "the start of the"
sen.e: Thus, the Ashikaga clan in Kanto were totally erased from the political scene by the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
sen.cmt: Clan→clanin削除戦国時代→the Sengoku period (period of warring states)

sen.j: しかし義明の孫・足利国朝は室町幕府滅亡後、天下人となった豊臣秀吉に足利氏再興を許され、下野国喜連川に領地を与えられて喜連川氏を称した。
sen.e: Kunitomo ASHIKAGA, grandson of Yoshiaki, was allowed by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, who united and reigned Japan after the collapse of the Muromachi Shogunate, to restore the Ashikaga Family, granted a fief in Kitsuregawa in the Province of Shimotsuke and assumed the name of the Kitsuregawa Family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kunitomo ASHIKAGA, the grandson of Yoshiaki, was allowed by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, who united and ruled Japan after the collapse of the Muromachi Shogunate, to restore the Ashikaga Clan, was granted a fief in Kitsuregawa in the Province of Shimotsuke and assumed the name of the Kitsuregawa Clan.

Kunitomo ASHIKAGA, the grandson of Yoshiaki, was allowed by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, who united and ruled Japan after the collapse of the Muromachi Shogunate, to restore the Ashikaga clan, was granted a fief in Kitsuregawa in the Province of Shimotsuke and assumed the name of the Kitsuregawa clan.

sen.j: その子孫は江戸時代には禄高5000石ながら10万石格の国主大名待遇の家として存続し、明治以後足利氏に復した。
sen.e: His descendants served the Tokugawa Shogunate as a daimyo with a stipend of 5,000 koku and a rank equivalent to a daimyo having his own domain, and returned to the original name Ashikaga after the Meiji Restoration.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His descendants served the Tokugawa Shogunate as daimyo of the top rank, though their stipend was only 5,000 koku, and returned to the original name of Ashikaga after the Meiji Restoration.
sen.cmt: deleted "a""with a stipend of 5,000 koku and a rank equivalent to a daimyo having his own domain"→"of the top rank, though their stipend was only 5,000 koku""Added "of"
sen.e: His descendants served the Tokugawa Shogunate as daimyo of the top rank, although their stipend was only 5,000 koku, and returned to the original name of Ashikaga after the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 喜連川氏系最後の当主であった足利惇氏が昭和58年（1983年）に死去して以降は、平島公方系の子孫が足利氏の祭祀を継承している。
sen.e: The last family head of the Kitsuregawa Kubo line, Atsuuji ASHIKAGA, died in 1983, and descendants of the Hirashima Kubo line of the Ashikaga Family inherited the role of the master of ceremony for the Ashikaga Family since then.
The last family head of the Kitsuregawa line, Atsuuji ASHIKAGA, died in 1983 and since then, descendants of the Hirashima Kubo line of the Ashikaga Clan have continued the family rituals.
sen.cmt: Deleted "Kubo""Family"→"Clan"Moved "since then""inherited the role of the master of ceremony for the Ashikaga Family"→"continued the family rituals"
sen.e: The last family head of the Kitsuregawa line, Atsuuji ASHIKAGA, died in 1983 and since then, descendants of the Hirashima Kubo line of the Ashikaga clan have continued the family rituals.

sen.j: 越前国には、足利義嗣の子孫が鞍谷御所として続いた。
sen.e: In the Province of Echizen, descendants of Yoshitsugu ASHIKAGA maintained the blood line under the name of Kuratani Gosho (Kuratani Palace).
In the Province of Echizen, descendants of Yoshitsugu ASHIKAGA maintained the blood line under the name of Kuratani Gosho (Kuratani Palace).
In the Province of Echizen, descendants of Yoshitsugu ASHIKAGA maintained the blood line under the name of Kuratani Gosho (Kuratani Palace).

tit.e: Ashikaga Family of the Fujiwara Clan Line

sen.j: なお、源姓足利氏に先立って、藤原氏姓足利氏が足利荘を根拠としていたが、1181年（養和元年）に藤原姓足利氏の足利忠綱が源頼朝の叔父源義広 (志田三郎先生)（志田義広）と結んで頼朝を討とうとしたため、頼朝により滅ぼされた。
sen.e: Prior to the Ashikaga Family of the Genji Clan, a family of the Fujiwara Clan settled at the Ashikaga Manor and assumed the name Ashikaga Family, but Tadatsuna ASHIKAGA of this family tried to defeat Yoritomo in cooperation with Yoritomo's uncle MINAMOTO no Yoshihiro (Shida Saburo Sensei or Teacher Saburo Shida) (Yoshihiro SHIDA) in 1181 but was defeated and destroyed by Yoritomo.

Prior to the Ashikaga branch of the Genji Clan, a branch of the Fujiwara Clan had settled in Ashikaga and assumed the name Ashikaga but in 1181, Tadatsuna ASHIKAGA of the Fujiwara Ashikaga was defeated by Yoritomo MINAMOTO following an attack by Tadatsuna in cooperation with Yoritomo's uncle, MINAMOTO no Yoshihiro (also known as Shida Saburo Sensei, or Teacher Saburo Shida, and Yoshihiro SHIDA).
sen.cmt: "Family"→"branch""Family"→"Clan""this family"→"the Fujiwara Ashikaga""tried to defeat"→"attacked"Added "also known as"Made the sections in brackets one clause.Changed word order of final part of sentence.
sen.e: Prior to the Ashikaga branch of the Genji clan, a branch of the Fujiwara clan had settled in Ashikaga and assumed the name Ashikaga but in 1181, Tadatsuna ASHIKAGA of the Fujiwara Ashikaga clan was defeated by Yoritomo following an attack by Tadatsuna in cooperation with Yoritomo's uncle, MINAMOTO no Yoshihiro (also known as Senjo Saburo SHIDA, or Teacher Saburo SHIDA, and Yoshihiro SHIDA).
sen.cmt: Clan→clan志田三郎先生→Senjo Saburo SHIDA [http://www.ktmchi.com/rekisi/kkr_20_09.html]としました。Shida→SHIDAMINAMOTO削除clan補足
